titles.title: Sentou Mecha Xabungle
戦闘 メカザブングル
Blue Gale XABUNGLE
Combat Mecha Xabungle
Xabungle
戦闘メカザブングル

recommendations.recommendation: Happy Tomino is the best there is!

anime.description: Zora was an outlaw planet where they had a rule that one could own stolen things if he could run away keeping it for three days. When Motorcycle gang, Sand Rat, was driving on the planet, they were attacked by a walker machine. Then, an injured boy, Jiron, helped them. Lag, the leader of Sand Rat was interested in Jiron because he was going to the bazaar to steal a walker machine. That bazaar was held by Charring Cargo who was a courier of Blue Stone, and there must be the guards of Carrying and rowdy fellows at the bazaar. Furthermore, to be surprised, it was Carrying`s latest walker machine, Xabungle, that he wanted to steal. Source: AnimeNfo

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: gunfights
tag.description: Fights where two or more parties are firing guns at one another.

tag.name: desert
tag.description: Setting with vast amounts of sand, merciless high temperatures, and very little water.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: Western
tag.description: The setting and/or world are pretty much like in Western films depicting the American Old West, with cowboys, Indians, deserts, small towns, bounty hunters, and lots of revolvers. Just think John Wayne, Clint Eastwood, and Sergio Leonne`s The Good, The Bad and The Ugly, or A Fistful of Dollars.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: real robot
tag.description: A smaller form of mecha with no special abilities. They are mostly used by deploying them in battle just like modern tanks. They can be mass produced and their pilots (usually military officers or soldiers) are (mostly) interchangeable. Tanks are often a threat to them and they are more easily destroyed than their bigger counterparts.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: soft science fiction
tag.description: Soft science fiction is a type of science fiction in which the science presented is scientifically inaccurate or unimportant to the story, in contrast to http://anidb.net/t4667 [hard science fiction]. Its elements generally present themselves via artistic licence. This is not to be confused with social science fiction, confusingly also called "soft science fiction", which is science fiction concerned with the "soft sciences" (social sciences), as opposed to the "hard sciences" (natural sciences).

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Jiron Amos
character.description: Main character of Xabungle. Jiron is a young man who witnessed his parents` murder at the hands of a breaker named Timp Sharon and swears revenge. Seeking to steal a Walker Machine, the Xabungle, he teams up with the Sand Rats group of bandits and is able to do so. Very headstrong, he ignores the "three day rule" imposed by the Innocent and makes multiple attempts to defeat Timp, often with disastrous results. Over the course of the series Jiron is one of the Iron Gear`s most accomplished Walker Machine pilots and mid-way through the series he upgrades to the Gallier. He later becomes leader of the Solt organization rebelling against the Innocent. Jiron is very dedicated to Elchi and attempts numerous times to rescue her following her capture by the Innocent, despite his allies disagreeing with him.

character.name: Rag Uralo
character.description: A member of the Sand Rat group of bandits who assists Jiron in stealing the Xabungle and later joins him aboard the Iron Gear. Rag doesn`t hold much loyalty to the Iron Gear and has plans to steal it someday. At one point she leaves the Iron Gear and stays with Akon Akag, one of Kid Horla`s subordinates, but returns to it following his death. She later shows a lot of admiration for Katakam as well. She is often in conflict with Elchi.

character.name: Chill
character.description: A young girl who is a part of the Sand Rats group of bandits and joins up with the Iron Gear.

character.name: Groggy
character.description:
A Rockman who Timp is able to convince to attack the Iron Gear such that he can take over the territory of the Iron Gear`s owner, Carrying Cargo. He participates in multiple attacks on the Iron Gear.
He is killed when Timp betrays him and causes the destruction of his landship.

character.name: Bigman
character.description:
A trader who fights against the Iron Gear multiple times.
He perishes following a battle against the Iron Gear outside of the Innocent`s dome.

character.name: Karas Karas
character.description: A trader who the Iron Gear had hoped to meet up with, he instead becomes their adversary when Kid Horla tricks Karas into thinking that the Iron Gear had attacked his forces. Karas is very dedicated to his wife Greta and younger brother Gary and swears revenge when Gary is killed following a battle. Following a battle in which he mistakenly believes his wife was killed, Karas abandons his landship and turns to the Innocent for help. Biel agrees to give him a landship identical to the Iron Gear. However, he is killed in the subsquent battle against the Iron Gear.

character.name: Greta Karas
character.description: Dedicated wife of trader Karas Karas. After failing against the Iron Gear in battle, she hides out, but her husband believes her to be dead and launches an attack on the Iron Gear that results in his death. Later in the series she returns, working as a Walker Machine pilot under Elchi during multiple attacks on the Iron Gear. Once Elchi returns to normal, she convinces Greta to move on from fighting and find a new love.

character.name: El Condor
character.description:
A man who saves Elchi when she leaves the Iron Gear and is pursued in the forest by Kid Horla`s men. Elchi quickly falls for him, but he doesn`t show the same feelings towards her. He is dedicated to protecting some local ruins.
He is killed in a battle with Kid Horla.

character.name: Arthur Rank
character.description: Leader of the Innocent, although Kashim King keeps him unaware of what is actually happening. Jiron and other members of the Solt organization desire to speak to him and they eventually take him from Kashim`s clutches, revealing the truth to him. Arthur`s good looks cause many of the female members of Solt to develop a crush on him. In bad health outside of the domes, Arthur nonetheless works to communicate to the Innocent that it is time to hand over the planet to the civilians and assists Jiron and the others in fighting against Kashim. He sacrifices himself in order to return Elchi to normal, taking on the evil personality that had been implanted in her and jumps out of the Iron Gear to his death.

character.name: Viram Key
character.description: Overseer of an Innocent dome that Biel brings Elchi to following her capture. Viram becomes principally responsible for overseeing Elchi while she is held by the Innocent and acts as a primary antagonist for the rest of the series. He is killed in the final episode when a missile falls on him.

character.name: Dowas
character.description: A member of the Innocent, he is subordinate of Biel, and later Viram. He leads multiple attacks against the Iron Gear.

character.name: Timp Sharon
character.description: A breaker who works for the Innocent to instigate conflicts. He is the man who killed Jiron`s parents, and as a result Jiron is obsessed with getting his revenge on him. Following multiple battles against Jiron he fakes his own death and disappears for a while. He later turns up again and battles the Iron Gear and Jiron multiple times to the end of the series.

character.name: Guiro Biel
character.description: Guiro acts as an assistant to Timp Sharon on his landship late in the series.

character.name: Fatman Big
character.description: Elchi`s bodyguard and servant. He is obsessed with protecting her, and during the second half of the series when she is in the clutches of the Innocent he makes multiple attempts to rescue her and bring her back to normal. He is typically silent although he does speak some basic words along with Elchi`s name later in the series. During the final battle he appears to have died while protecting Elchi, but to everyone`s surprise suddenly appears alive again in the final scene.

character.name: Kotsett Memuma
character.description: Chief mechanic on the Iron Gear, as well as its main pilot throughout the series.

character.name: Katakam Zushim
character.description: A leader of the Solt organization that works with Jiron and the others. Rag has a crush on him when he first joins up with them. He and Jiron constantly argue with one another and he falls out of favor with those on the Iron Gear. An attempt to seize the Iron Gear fails and he later puts himself in harms way, in contrast to his earlier behavior. When the landship he is on explodes everyone believes him to be dead, and secretly watching his own funeral he decides to remain out of sight of everyone.

character.name: Birin Nada
character.description: A member of the Solt organization who joins up with the Iron Gear in the latter half of the series.

character.name: Maria Maria
character.description: A peaceful girl who takes care of orphans and grows vegetables. She is initially against fighting, but later in the series joins up with the Solt organization along with Medic Held, acting largely as a medic.

character.name: Medic Held
character.description: A doctor who Jiron steals from at the start of the series, he later joins the Solt organization as their main doctor.

character.name: Toron Milan
character.description:
Jiron meets Toron in a town when the Iron Gear passes through and he shows interest in a bazooka that she also had been interested in. This leads to the two getting into a fist fight with each other. She later joins up with Jiron in battle, piloting a Walker Machine.
Toron is killed in this battle, upsetting Jiron greatly. Her influence however later assists the Iron Gear in joining up with the Solt organization.

character.name: Elchi Cargo
character.description:
Daughter of Carrying Cargo, she becomes its captain following his death. Elchi is obsessed with culture and often has aspirations of abandoning the Iron Gear as a result, but continuously returns to it. She angers easily and is often in conflict with many members of the Iron Gear crew. In the second half of the series she is captured by the Innocent and brainwashed into desiring the destruction of the Iron Gear and the death of Jiron. She is given the Iron Gear-like landship Gear Gear, and later another landship which she calls the Carrying. She launches multiple attacks on the Iron Gear with these ships. She is often in conflict with her subordinates.
As the series draws to a close Elchi is captured by Jiron and the others. They are able to remove her brainwashing by shifting her new personality to Arthur Rank, and Elchi returns to her normal self. During the final battle she fights against Kashim and Viram but is blinded by an explosion.

character.name: Blume
character.description: A member of the Sand Rats group of bandits that helps out Jiron and joins him on the Iron Gear. Like Rag, Blume does not hold much long term loyalty to the Iron Gear and eventually decides to abandon it, temporarily acquiring his own landship. He later returns to the Iron Gear for the remainder of the series.

character.name: Dyke
character.description: A member of the Sand Rats group of bandits that helps out Jiron and joins him on the Iron Gear. Dyke is a helpful and loyal member of the team and occasionally assists with the piloting of Walker Machines.

character.name: Propopief Sandora
character.description: Husband of Lovely Rose, he is a stage director who is stationed aboard the Iron Gear. He acts as times as the Iron Gear`s impromptu medic, until Medic Held joins the ship.

character.name: Kaldas Burn
character.description: A landship captain who joins up with the Solt organization and frequently helps out the Iron Gear. He is killed when a missile blows up his landship in the final battle.

character.name: Kid Horla
character.description: A breaker who worked under Carrying Cargo. He is obsessed with Elchi and desires for her to marry him. After his initial attempt to marry Elchi and take over the Iron Gear fails, he flees, then later works with the Innocent against the Iron Gear. His obsession with Elchi remains throughout the series.

character.name: Biel
character.description: A high ranking member of the Innocent in the first half of the series. He is later demoted and abandoned following the chaos caused by Jiron across multiple Innocent domes. He is found in the wilderness by Blume and reveals the truth about the innocent and civilization to Jiron and the others. He is killed during an attempt to rescue Elchi from the Innocent.

character.name: Kassim King
character.description:
The elderly Kashim is de facto leader of the Innocent, being able to accomplish his ideals while hiding certain facts from true Innocent leader, Arthur Rank. Towards the end of the series he becomes the primary antagonist and makes multiple attempts to destroy the Iron Gear and Solt organization, as well as Arthur himself. It is his personality that was implanted into Elchi`s during her brainwashing.
During the final battle, Kashim`s plan to attack the Xabungle with a missile backfires when it causes other missiles to topple and go off, resulting in his death.

character.name: Geraba Geraba
character.description: A breaker who initially worked under Carrying Cargo, and acts as Kid Horla`s subordinate throughout the series.

character.name: Gavlet Gablae
character.description: A trader who is recruited by Timp Sharon to go after the Iron Gear. She works under fellow trader Bigman, who has provided her with the land ship Purple Cat. She complains when people don`t call her "Miss Gavlet". The character shares the same name with another Tomino character who appeared in the anime Heavy Metal L-Gaim.

character.name: Rose Sandorla
character.description: Typically referred to as "Lovely Rose", she is a dancing instructor stationed aboard the Iron Gear. She is the wife of Propopief.

character.name: Muuna Tat
character.description: A member of the Hanawan people, she shows sympathy towards Jiron after meeting him. She sneaks aboard the Iron Gear, trying to find a book that she believes will lead her to the Hanawan holy land. She agrees to act as a hostage of the Iron Gear to end the attacks of fellow Hanawan Genna.

character.name: Genna Haram
character.description: A militaristic member of the Hanawan people, he leads attacks on the Iron Gear after being led to believe by Kid Horla that the Iron Gear contains a book showing the location of the Hanawan holy land.

episode.title: 命をかけて生きてます
I Live By Risking My Life!
ザブングルはもらったよ
We`ve Got Xabungle!
なんで掟を破るのさ
Why Do You Break The Law?
あんたジロンの何なのさ
What Are You Up to, Jiron?
信ずるものは浮かばれる
Those Who Believe Are Saved
花は野に咲けマリア花
In the Field Blooms a Flower Named Maria
女の勇者はこわいです
Brave Women Are Frightening
追いかけて, 追いかけて
Chase Me! Chase Me!
謎また謎のイノセント
The Many Mysteries of the Innocent
あとは野となる大破壊
A Great Destruction Leaving Nothing Behind
ティンプ, 悪あがき
Timp`s Futile Resistance
泥まみれ, やけっくそ
Covered In Mud And Desperate
家出がなんで悪いのさ
What`s Wrong With Running Away from Home?
役者やのオで大勝負
A Duel with Actors and Noh Theatre
惚れられて, 惚れられて
Falling in Love, Being in Love
ラグよ帰れ! 我が胸に
Rag, Come Back! To My Heart
死闘, 激闘, 泣きカラス
A Fierce Death Machine! Crying Karas
捨て身と捨て身の大戦闘
A Big Battle of Two Reckless Fighters
うたえ! 戦士の歌を
Sing the Song of the Warrior!
弱味みつけたイノセント
The Innocent`s Weakness
イノセントだって必死
Even the Innocent Can Get Desperate
頭にきたらおしまいよ
If They Get the Head, We`re Done For
俺の勝手はあんたの勝手
My Convenience is Your Convenience
ファットマン思いはるかに
Fatman`s Feelings Fly Far
個人プレーじゃ駄ー目
Going Solo Is No Go
カタカム, やぶれかぶれ
Katakam, Ragged Into Bits
アーサー様・お大事に
Take Care, Sir Arthur
太陽に向って立て
Stand Up to Face the Sun
